title: Vonovia acquires majority stake in Hembla for $1.26 billion
text:
Vonovia SE said Monday that it has agreed to buy a majority stake in Swedish property company Hembla AB.

Germany’s Vonovia VNA, -1.07% said it will acquire a 61.2% stake in the company HEM.B, +11.51% , equaling around 69.3% of voting rights, for 12.22 billion Swedish krona ($1.26 billion).

Vonovia is buying the stake in Hembla from Vega Holdco SARL, a holding owned by real estate funds advised by the Blackstone Group Inc., it said.

The German property company will acquire around 6.1 million class A shares and around 50.7 million class B shares in Hembla for 215 Swedish krona a share, a premium of 11.5% to the closing price Friday, it said.

Vonovia will make another offer for the remaining shares once the transaction is cleared in October or November this year, it said.
description: Vonovia SE said Monday that it has agreed to buy a majority stake in Swedish property company Hembla AB.
